nodes.name: Junction Above Bottom Climb
nodes.note: This is under the orange door, below the shot blocks, but above the bottom climb

nodes.name: Middle of Bottom Climb Junction
nodes.note: This is meant to contain all Rippers in the bottom climb except the bottom one

nodes.name: Top Climb Junction
nodes.note: This is meant to contain all Rippers in the top climb except the bottom one

strats.name: Red Tower Spark
note: 2- Select Missiles, position Samus roughly in the horizontal center of the room.
4- In very quick succession, shoot a missile upwards then spark up.
If done right, Samus will pass the Missile, break the bomb blocks, then be passed by the Missile which will break the shot blocks at the top.

to.note: Direct link for shinespark. Other strats should go 1 -> 9 -> 5.

strats.name: IBJ
strats.note: Doing an IBJ without killing the Rippers may be doable, but it would have to be a harder variation of IBJ.

to.note: This link is only for sparking. Other strats go 8 -> 7 -> 6.

strats.name: Space Jump
note: This strat exists on the belief that only the final wall jump is tricky
The top Ripper has to be killed otherwise there's no room to leverage Space Jump as an actual advantage.

strats.name: X-Ray Exit Damage Boost
note: If you wait long enough, a Waver will arrive.
With one dboost off it on its way back, you can follow it across and use it for i-frames, getting through with 5 hits.

strats.name: X-Ray Exit Spike Floor
strats.note: This strat is simply running and jumping across the spikes.

strats.name: X-Ray Access Damage Boost
note: A precise strat that involves crossing both gaps by dboosting off Wavers.
The wavers are also used for iframes to avoid taking damage from any spikes.

nodes.name: Top of Statue with Broken Block
nodes.note: This junction is used to separate the breaking of the bomb block from escaping the room.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: There are additional requirements to get back out. It's a softlock if they aren't met.

to.note: 2 -> 3 and 3 -> 1 are fully separated, because it takes two PBs to break the block and then get into the tunnel.

strats.name: X-Ray Escape Wall Morph
strats.note: Maybe a little bit harder than in West Sand Hole, since you also need to change direction.

strats.name: X-Ray Escape Running Morph
strats.note: A running mid-air mockball can squeeze into the hole with good enough timing.

enemies.name: Yapping Maw
enemies.note: Can pickup the drops without taking damage

strats.name: Base
note: Runway not usable if the shot blocks are broken.
Those blocks are not an obstacle right now, but there's no need to destroy them except when travelling between nodes 2 and 3.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This longer runway is only available if the green gate is open.

strats.name: Backtrack
note: Only doable if entering the room from 5.
Only worthwhile to go kill the Zeros for PBs (and/or Cacatacs for Supers) then go back out.

strats.name: Base

obstacles.note: To avoid redundant requirements, killing the Sidehoppers requires going to 3 and back.

note: This runway requires the PB blocks to be intact, but the sidehoppers to be dead.
This is relevant because it can limit the player's options for killing the Sidehoppers.

unlockStrats.name: Base
unlockStrats.note: To avoid redundant requirements, obstacle must be destroyed by going to 3 and back.

enemies.name: Yapping Maw
enemies.note: Wait for the Maws to reach up before killing them and the drops are reachable

strats.name: Morph Power Beam Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: The Sidehoppers can't hit a morphed Samus, so they can be picked off damage-free.

strats.name: PB Sidehopper Kill
note: This is essentially redundant with the Morph Power Beam kill.
It wouldn't be redundant if Power Beam were to be taken away, though.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: It's a bit pointless to put the obstacle requirement in since you can't get there without breaking the obstacle, but might as well since we have the obstacle.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: To avoid redundant requirements, obstacle must be destroyed on the way in.
